prompt:
What is an example of a specific and unusual plant species that you would like to see added to the list of plants in the museum? Why?
I would like to see the [Wolffia arrhiza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wolffia_arrhiza) added to the museum's collection due to its unique and unusual appearance. This plant species has a long history of use in traditional medicine, particularly for treating skin conditions. Additionally, it is also known for its ability to thrive in a wide variety of environments, even in nutrient-poor soil.
